overview.business_description: Swiss mobile telecommunications operator providing wireless services to consumers and businesses. Third-largest mobile operator in Switzerland behind Swisscom and Sunrise. Known for competitive pricing and challenger positioning in the Swiss market.
business_positives: Strong Swiss market with high ARPU
Challenger positioning driving market share gains
Xavier Niel/NJJ Capital ownership - experienced telecom investor
Recent rating upgrade (B2 to B1) reflects improving credit
overview.fatal_flaw: Smaller scale vs Swisscom and Sunrise; B1 rating still sub-investment grade; private ownership limits transparency
overview.ownership: NJJ Capital SAS (Xavier Niel family office)
overview.recent_news: May 2025: Moody's upgraded CFR to B1 from B2 (stable outlook). May 2025: EUR 200m TLB add-on at 98.5-98.75. Jan 2025: Priced EUR 420m SSN at 4.5% and EUR 430m TLB at E+275bps.

equity_market_value.note: Private - owned by NJJ Capital SAS (Xavier Niel)

key_deals.deal: EUR 420m SSN at 4.5% and EUR 430m TLB at E+275bps

credit_opinion.summary: Salt is Switzerland's third-largest mobile operator, owned by Xavier Niel's NJJ Capital. Recent upgrade to B1 (from B2) reflects improving fundamentals. Swiss market offers high ARPUs and stable regulatory environment. Challenger positioning vs Swisscom and Sunrise. Limited financial disclosure as private company.
credit_opinion.recommendation: NEUTRAL - Improving credit in stable Swiss market; B1 rating upgrade positive
